Text:
For WDTV play, it needs to be remuxed to mkv with mkvtoolnix, and then the AAC audio needs to be converted to AC3 using Popcorn Audio Converter.

Unfortunately, this is the only 1080p copy that's even remotely synched with the audio. And that's not saying much, because it's still about a quarter-second out of synch.

To fix the audio sync issues, when you remux, introduce a 150ms delay in the audio track. It's almost a perfect sync.

It appears that all the currently available copies are from the same source file, as they all have delayed video tracks. Why no one thought "hey, maybe I should fix the audio sync" is beyond me, instead of just changing formats, adding additional audio tracks, subs, etc. You're all just polishing turds and should be ashamed of yourselves.
